qas.question: What was the essential piece Cubist architects explained in their theoretical rules?
What's  window shapes di Czech Cubist architects use?
What feelings should Cubist architecture evoke in viewer?
What was the essential piece Cubist architects explained in their non-theoretical rules?
What's window shapes di Czech Cubist architects not use?
What feelings should Cubist architecture not evoke in viewer?
What type of doors were not used?

context: In their theoretical rules, the Cubist architects expressed the requirement of <a0_0>dynamism<a0_0/>, which would surmount the matter and calm contained in it, through a creative idea, so that the result would evoke feelings of <a2_0><b3_0><b5_0>dynamism<b3_0/> and expressive<b5_0/> plasticity<a2_0/> in the viewer. This should be achieved by shapes derived from pyramids, cubes and prisms, by arrangements and compositions of oblique surfaces, mainly triangular, sculpted facades in protruding crystal-like units, reminiscent of the so-called diamond cut, or even cavernous that are reminiscent of the late Gothic architecture. In this way, the entire surfaces of the facades including even the gables and dormers are sculpted. The grilles as well as other architectural ornaments attain a <b6_0>three-dimensional<b6_0/> form. Thus, new forms of windows and doors were also created, e. g. <a1_0><b4_0>hexagonal<b4_0/><a1_0/> windows. Czech Cubist architects also designed Cubist furniture.
